title: Sentinel-4 offers first glimpses of air pollutants
summary: The new Copernicus Sentinel-4 mission has delivered its first images, highlighting concentrations of atmospheric nitrogen dioxide, sulphur dioxide and ozone. Despite being preliminary, these images mark a major milestone in Europe’s ability to monitor air quality all the way from geostationary orbit, 36 000 kilometres above Earth.

title: Belgian startup Nxgsat raises early funds for virtual 5G satellite modem
summary:
A Belgian startup led by satellite networking veterans announced $1.4 million in seed funding Oct. 21 to develop a virtual 5G modem, designed for multi-orbit compatibility across traditionally closed communications infrastructure.
The post Belgian startup Nxgsat raises early funds for virtual 5G satellite modem appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: The mystery object that struck a plane in flight? It was probably a weather balloon
summary: WindBorne says its balloons are compliant with all applicable airspace regulations.

title: Duffy says NASA will open Artemis 3 lander contract to competition
summary:
NASA’s acting administrator says he will “open up the contract” SpaceX holds to land astronauts on the moon for the Artemis 3 mission because the company has fallen behind schedule.

title: America needs a ‘Plan B’ to reach the moon first
summary:
China is on track to land its first crew on the lunar surface by 2030 and establish a base at the resource-rich south pole — a site that offers continuous sunlight, access to water ice and control of the most valuable real estate beyond Earth. title: Avio Reaches Key Milestone in the Development of its FD1 Rocket Demonstrator
summary:
Italian rocket builder Avio has completed a key hot-fire test of its methane-powered MR10 liquid rocket engine, which will initially power a single-stage demonstrator being developed under the company’s Space Transportation System (STS) programme. The company will now move on to the integration and testing phase of the single-stage FD1 demonstrator. In March 2023, Avio […]
